intro: Brassica rapa var. hybrida, commonly known as Chinese cabbage, is a cultivated variety of the mustard family. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that form a compact head, often used in Asian cuisine. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in cool climates. It is an annual plant that prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Its botanical features include small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by round, spherical seed pods.
